title: True if tax rate balance budget at full employment

content.question: Assume that with a proportional tax system, the government always sets the tax rate at a level that yields a balanced budget at full employment. Which of the following is necessarily true?

choices.label: The government budget will balance every year.
The government budget will be in deficit over the business cycle.
The national debt will increase in any year the economy operates below full employment.
Crowding out of private investment will occur whenever the economy operates at full employment.
The tax system will be destabilizing.

content.answer: The national debt will increase in any year the economy operates below full employment.

topic.text: 5.4: Government Deficits and the National Debt
